knowledgePoints.title: Integration by parts
knowledgePoints.summary: A technique for integrating products of functions using the formula \(\int u\,dv = uv-\int v\,du\).
commonPitfalls: Choosing the wrong \(u\) and \(dv\) can make the integral more complicated

knowledgePoints.title: Volume of revolution (disk method)
knowledgePoints.summary: Finding the volume of a solid generated by rotating a region about an axis using \(V=\pi\int_a^b y^2\,dx\).

knowledgePoints.title: Triple-angle identity
commonPitfalls: Incorrect signs when applying the identity

knowledgePoints.title: Double-angle identities
commonPitfalls: Mixing up signs in the formulas

knowledgePoints.title: Completing the square
knowledgePoints.summary: Rewriting a quadratic expression in the form \((x+a)^2+b^2\) to facilitate integration or other operations.
commonPitfalls: Incorrect sign when completing the square
Forgetting to adjust the constant term

knowledgePoints.title: Arctan substitution for \(\int \frac{1}{(x+a)^2+b^2}\,dx\)
knowledgePoints.summary: Using substitution to evaluate integrals of the form \(\int \frac{dx}{(x+a)^2+b^2}\) resulting in \(\arctan\).
commonPitfalls: Incorrect substitution leading to wrong limits
